Hello! Please, generate a Google Chrome extension to automate image generation on chatgpt. Make it a popup.
Features:
- Dark theme UI
- a multiline text input field "Image Prompts".
	- User can type there or drag and drop text files (.txt or .md)
	- if a file is dropped there, parse this:
		- Look for a line starting with "--- IMAGE" (case insensitive). If present, add everything from the next line to the next "---" line, or to the end of file if no "---" lines are present.
		- If no "--- IMAGE" (case insensitive) is found, just add everything inside the text file to the area
- a row with:
	- a number input field "Start Number", default to 1
	- a text input field "Output Folder" with a button to open a system folder picker, default location to the Downloads library
	- a checkbox "Is Variation", default to false
	- A button "Add to List".
		- When pressed, it will add the following as a new line on the "Image Prompts" list:
			##### [Variation] [XXXXX] "[output]"
			- where [Variation] is the field "Is Variation", [XXXXX] is the start number formated with 5 zeroes (00001, 00013...), and [output] is the output path 
- a row with:
	- "Clear List" button
- a row with an input text "Generate Again Prompt", with default value " (If you would generate the same image you already generated with this prompt, please, generate a different image, but still using the same prompt. Do it as if you didn't had generated that image before)" - PS: the " (" space in the default value is intentional.
- a row with a number input "Wait Time Between Generations", default to 300 seconds
- a row with:
	- a button "Start Generating Images"
	- a button "Cancel Generation"
- A log area

Functions:
- when Start Generating Images is pressed
	1. look in the browser for a chat gpt open tab "https://chatgpt.com/". If not present, show in the log and stop generation.
	2. set the "Current Line" to the first line of the "Image Prompts"
	3. parse the Current Line:
		- If it starts with "#####", then it's metadata
			- get the [Variation] to be the variation for the next prompts
			- get the [XXXXX] to set as the starting number for the next prompts
			- get the [output] to be the output folder for the next prompts
		- If no "#####" line is present, just use the values on the Start Number and Output Folder fields.
	4. set the metada for "Current Project". It will be the same until we find a new ##### line. Set "Current Line" for the next non empty line on "Image Prompts" (a line with only spaces or tabs is an empty line as well)
	5. loop Current Line until we find a ##### line or there are no more lines:
		5.1. get the current line text
			- if Variation is true, then add the "Generate Again Prompt" value to the end of the prompt (in the same line), before sending it to the GPT
		5.2. send the current prompt to the #input_area element. Wait the #send_button to appear
		5.3. trigger the #send_button
		5.4. wait 1 second, and check if image is being generated, or if it's done, every 1 second
			- if #image_being_generated or #stop_button is present, then wait, the image is not over yet (nor a text response)
		5.5. if #response_without_image or #last_response_without_image_full appears, then we need to create a dummy image to show that. Generate an image that's just a dark blue screen with the text:
			"Image [XXXXX] not generated. Prompt: [prompt]"
			- where [XXXXX] is the image number, and [prompt] is the prompt sent for that image.
			- after that, skip to the next image, increasing Current Line and doing all item 5. again
			- save this dummy image as if it would be a normal image, but append the string " - ERROR" to the image name as a sufix
				- Download it to the correct folder
			- tag current response as already seem, and ignore it for the next prompts
		5.6. if #response_with_image or #last_response_with_image_full is present, then the image is ready:
			- Download the image as .png to the output folder
			- keep doing the loop, going back to item 5.
			- tag current response as already seem, and ignore it for the next prompts
	6. if you find a ##### line, then that project is over, go back to item 3. and parse the line again, and start the next project.
	7. if there are no more lines in the prompt, just finish generation and log "GENERATION COMPLETED"
	


*** IMPORTANT: before starting, look for everything inside #full_conversation_area, and ignore all that for the image downloading and prompt sending.
as soon as a #copy_button is present, the image is ready (present on the last #response_with_image or #last_response_with_image_full)
